Through original programming, documentaries, and expert-led discussions, MHTN aims to increase awareness, provide valuable information, and encourage open conversations about mental well-being.

programme.title: Quo Vadis TV
programme.desc: Quo Vadis TV is committed to sharing the Biblical message in a way that makes Christian living practical, realistic, and attainable. Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

programme.title: Live: Bloomberg Technology
programme.desc: Technology is not only becoming an increasingly important part of people's lives but also of the American economy. "Bloomberg Technology" takes a look at how the latest happenings in the tech industry are affecting the U.S. markets. Analysis, commentary, interviews and interactive graphics are among the staples of the show that help viewers understand the impact the technology sector has on the economy. The show, which was originally titled "Bloomberg West," is anchored by Emily Chang in San Francisco.

programme.title: Live: Bloomberg Real Yield
programme.desc: Not everyone has a lot of money to invest, which is why Bloomberg has financial indices that are based on fixed income, which is also the focus on this weekly show. The program covers news and trends in the fixed-income market and includes interviews with guests from major financial institutions. "Bloomberg Real Yield" incorporates data and analysis from terminal bond experts to help dive into topics that are moving the bond markets in order to help empower viewers to make knowledgeable financial decisions.

programme.desc: Add the first coin ever to feature a US Army Privy Mark to your collection today! Graded Proof 70 Ultra Cameo, this 2025 Army Privy American Silver Eagle celebrates the 250th Anniversary of the US Army. Ranks among the lowest mintage of the series!

programme.title: The David Rubenstein Show: Peer to Peer Conversations
programme.desc: Financier and philanthropist David Rubenstein talks with his peers - leaders of some of America's biggest companies - in this interview show that aims to answer the question of what makes a great leader; Rubenstein uses his chats to explore successful leadership skills through the personal and professional choices made by the business world's most influential people; Rubenstein travels across the country to find out about the business leaders' stories and uncover information about their paths to success; the interview subjects include Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates, Berkshire Hathaway chairman Warren Buffett and Pepsi CEO Indra Nooyi.

programme.title: Rimfire
programme.desc: An undercover Army captain (James Millican) links missing gold and murder to a gambler's (Reed Hadley) ghost.

programme.title: Colorado Territory
programme.desc: After escaping from jail, outlaw Wes McQueen is convinced by his old partner in crime to do one last heist.

programme.title: Springfield Rifle
programme.desc: A Union major (Gary Cooper) with a wife (Phyllis Thaxter) and son goes undercover as a traitor to stop a Confederate raider (David Brian).

programme.title: Lady in the Lake
programme.desc: Private eye Phillip Marlowe (Robert Montgomery) wants to get out of the detective racket and into crime writing. But when he's called to the office of editor Adrienne Fromsett (Audrey Totter), it's not to talk about his story ideas -- she wants him to locate the missing wife of her boss, Mr. Kingsby (Leon Ames). The assignment quickly becomes complicated when bodies start turning up. This Raymond Chandler adaptation is notable for being filmed entirely from Marlowe's first-person perspective.

programme.title: The Phenix City Story
programme.desc: Based on a sensational news story, this film looks at the murder of Albert L. Patterson (John McIntire), who hopes to win the an attorney general's job in Alabama. Phenix City is a dangerous place to run for election without the backing of local gangsters, but urged on by his ex-military son, John (Richard Kiley), Albert promises to restore law and order to the crime-ridden city. Though he pays the ultimate price for his bravery, his candidacy inspires residents to stand up to the mobsters.

programme.title: Assignment -- Paris
programme.desc: Cocky investigative reporter Jimmy Race (Dana Andrews) and his idealistic rival, Jeanne Moray (Märta Torén), tangle over international espionage and Cold War tensions in Communist Hungary. While following an explosive story about an accused American spy, Jimmy inadvertently brings the unwanted attention of Hungarian agent Anton Borvitch (Donald Randolph) to Jeanne's ongoing investigation of possible collusion between Hungarian and Yugoslavian politicians, endangering both reporters' lives.

programme.title: Cash on Demand
programme.desc: A British banker (Peter Cushing) pretends to cooperate with a would-be robber (Andre Morell) holding his wife and son.

programme.title: Riding the California Trail
programme.desc: The Cisco Kid (Gilbert Roland) and Pancho (Martin Garralaga) rescue a senorita.

programme.title: Daniel Boone
programme.desc: The frontiersman (George O'Brien) leads settlers to Kentucky, where a white renegade (John Carradine) unites tribes against them.

programme.title: Through the Bible With Les Feldick
programme.desc: Les Feldick, an Oklahoma farmer and rancher with a special gift for teaching the Bible; his simple and nondenominational approach on the program "Through the Bible with Les Feldick" has reached millions around the world with the Gospel of Grace.

programme.title: Learn More About Medicare Advantage Plans from Humana
programme.desc: Are you making the most of your Medicare coverage? In this program you will learn about the variety of Humana Medicare plans designed to fit your needs, your lifestyle, and your budget.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Earp reluctantly agrees to hire his younger brother Morgan as a deputy when Morgan stops a robbery; Morgan assists Deputy Hal when Curly Bill Brocius holds up a stagecoach.

programme.title: Lady in the Lake
programme.desc: Private eye Phillip Marlowe (Robert Montgomery) wants to get out of the detective racket and into crime writing. But when he's called to the office of editor Adrienne Fromsett (Audrey Totter), it's not to talk about his story ideas -- she wants him to locate the missing wife of her boss, Mr. Kingsby (Leon Ames). The assignment quickly becomes complicated when bodies start turning up. This Raymond Chandler adaptation is notable for being filmed entirely from Marlowe's first-person perspective.

programme.title: The Phenix City Story
programme.desc: Based on a sensational news story, this film looks at the murder of Albert L. Patterson (John McIntire), who hopes to win the an attorney general's job in Alabama. Phenix City is a dangerous place to run for election without the backing of local gangsters, but urged on by his ex-military son, John (Richard Kiley), Albert promises to restore law and order to the crime-ridden city. Though he pays the ultimate price for his bravery, his candidacy inspires residents to stand up to the mobsters.

programme.title: Assignment -- Paris
programme.desc: Cocky investigative reporter Jimmy Race (Dana Andrews) and his idealistic rival, Jeanne Moray (Märta Torén), tangle over international espionage and Cold War tensions in Communist Hungary. While following an explosive story about an accused American spy, Jimmy inadvertently brings the unwanted attention of Hungarian agent Anton Borvitch (Donald Randolph) to Jeanne's ongoing investigation of possible collusion between Hungarian and Yugoslavian politicians, endangering both reporters' lives.

programme.title: Springfield Rifle
programme.desc: During the Civil War, Union forces stationed in Colorado are hampered by raiders who have been stealing their horses as they travel through the mountains. When several commanding officers begin to suspect a traitor is revealing troop movements, Maj. Lex Kearny (Gary Cooper) goes undercover to investigate. However, the assignment strains Kearny's relationship with his wife, Erin (Phyllis Thaxter), after he chooses to continue the operation instead of searching for their runaway son.

programme.title: Fort Worth
programme.desc: Reformed gunman Ned Britt (Randolph Scott) travels to Fort Worth, Texas, to take over the abandoned newspaper. Crooked trail boss Gabe Clevenger (Ray Teal), a former antagonist of Ned's, challenges him on the trail. Ned refuses to fight -- which disappoints fellow passenger Flora Talbot (Phyllis Thaxter), who had taken a liking to him but now sees him as weak. In Fort Worth, Ned discovers Clevenger is battling the burgeoning railroad and decides to fight back using the power of the press.

programme.title: Gunfighters
programme.desc: In Texas, gunfighter Brazos Kane (Randolph Scott) decides to lay down his guns for good and rides out to visit his best friend -- only to witness his murder. When Brazos takes the body to the nearby ranch of the powerful Banner (Griff Barnett), the rancher accuses him of the murder. Brazos leaves Banner's daughter, Bess (Barbara Britton), a vital piece of evidence in the crime, and then must evade Banner and a crooked sheriff as he reluctantly takes up arms to prove his innocence.

programme.title: The Lady From Shanghai
programme.desc: A seaman becomes involved in a complex murder plot when he is hired to work on a yacht. He soon finds himself implicated in the murder, despite his innocence. The film is best remembered for it's climax "hall of mirrors" scene with a shoot out amidst shards of shattering glass.

programme.title: Key Largo
programme.desc: This classic film noir by John Huston stars Humphrey Bogart as World War II vet Frank McCloud. Visiting Key Largo to pay his respects to the family of his late war buddy, McCloud attempts to comfort his comrade's widow, Nora (Lauren Bacall), and father, James Temple (Lionel Barrymore), who operate a hotel. But McCloud realizes that mobsters, led by the infamous Johnny Rocco (Edward G. Robinson), are staying in the hotel. When the criminals take over the establishment, conflict is inevitable.

programme.title: Johnny O'Clock
programme.desc: When an employee at an illegal gambling den dies suspiciously, her sister, Nancy (Evelyn Keyes), looks into the situation and falls for Johnny O'Clock (Dick Powell), a suave partner in the underground casino. Selfish and non-committal by nature, Johnny slowly begins to return Nancy's affection and decides to run away with her, but conflict within his business threatens their plans. As Johnny tries to distance himself from the casino, his shady past comes back to haunt him.

programme.title: Trail of the Rustlers
programme.desc: When a member of the villainous Mahoney family is slain while escaping the jail cell he'd been put in by Steve Armitage (Charles Starrett), aka the Durango Kid, the dead man's relatives vow to take down the Kid by any means necessary. Chick Mahoney (Don Harvey) poses as the Kid and tries to ruin the cowboy's reputation by stealing from nearby ranchers, but with the help of sidekick Smiley Burnette (Smiley Burnette), the Kid sets out to retrieve the stolen goods and repair his good name.

programme.title: The Fatal Mallet
programme.desc: Three men play dirty tricks to charm a beautiful young woman.

Crooked trail boss Gabe Clevenger (Ray Teal), a former antagonist of Ned's, challenges him on the trail. Ned refuses to fight -- which disappoints fellow passenger Flora Talbot (Phyllis Thaxter), who had taken a liking to him but now sees him as weak. In Fort Worth, Ned discovers Clevenger is battling the burgeoning railroad and decides to fight back using the power of the press.

programme.title: Gunfighters
programme.desc: In Texas, gunfighter Brazos Kane (Randolph Scott) decides to lay down his guns for good and rides out to visit his best friend -- only to witness his murder. When Brazos takes the body to the nearby ranch of the powerful Banner (Griff Barnett), the rancher accuses him of the murder. Brazos leaves Banner's daughter, Bess (Barbara Britton), a vital piece of evidence in the crime, and then must evade Banner and a crooked sheriff as he reluctantly takes up arms to prove his innocence.

programme.title: Tall in the Saddle
programme.desc: Cowboy Rocklin (John Wayne) rides into a dusty western township where he's been promised work on a ranch. But when he finds that his future boss has been gunned down, he's forced to find work elsewhere. Despite his sexist attitudes, Rocklin charms the fiery Arly (Ella Raines) with his cavalier bravado and lands a job at her family's ranch. There, however, he learns that Judge Garvey (Ward Bond) was involved in his original employer's murder and is now trying to steal the dead man's land.

programme.title: Devil's Doorway
programme.desc: Lance Poole (Robert Taylor) is a Native American who left his tribal homelands to fight for the Union in the Civil War. Despite earning the Congressional Medal of Honor for his heroic duties in the line of fire, when he returns home he's still faced with hatred and racism from the white community that neighbors his village. Unable to own property because he's not considered a citizen of the United States, he fights a lawyer's (Louis Calhern) attempts to take over his tribe's hard-earned land.

programme.title: Framed
programme.desc: Truck driver Mike Lambert (Glenn Ford) is a down-and-out mining engineer searching for a job. When his rig breaks down in a small town, he happens upon Paula Craig (Janis Carter), a venomous seductress. When Craig's boyfriend, Steve Price (Barry Sullivan), robs a bank, they intend to frame Lambert, but Craig murders Price, takes the money and convinces Lambert that he killed Price in a blackout. Lambert is ready to skip town, until he learns a friend is set to take the fall.

programme.title: Walk East on Beacon
programme.desc: An FBI agent (George Murphy) works with a refugee scientist (Finlay Currie) and the Coast Guard to crack a Soviet spy ring in Boston.

programme.title: Johnny O'Clock
programme.desc: A dancer (Evelyn Keyes), a casino gambler (Dick Powell) and a detective (Lee J. Cobb) want to know who has killed a policeman and a hatchecker.

programme.title: The Vagabond
programme.desc: Charlie rescues a kidnapped and abused woman from Gypsies, and the two seem to be falling in love until a rival and her parents arrive. As she starts to leave with the rival, she realizes her heart belongs to Charlie.

programme.title: Feudin' Rhythm
programme.desc: A snooty sponsor wants the star (Eddy Arnold) of a country-western radio show fired because she wants him kept away from her nephew, who happens to be the singer's son.

programme.desc: Paid programming.

programme.title: King of the Bandits
programme.desc: The Cisco Kid and Pancho track an outlaw responsible for a series of stagecoach robberies and masquerading as the Kid.

programme.title: Through the Bible With Les Feldick
programme.desc: Les Feldick, an Oklahoma farmer and rancher with a special gift for teaching the Bible; his simple and nondenominational approach on the program "Through the Bible with Les Feldick" has reached millions around the world with the Gospel of Grace.

programme.title: Learn More About Medicare Advantage Plans from Humana
programme.desc: Are you making the most of your Medicare coverage? In this program you will learn about the variety of Humana Medicare plans designed to fit your needs, your lifestyle, and your budget.

programme.title: The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Holmes is consulted by a man who is concerned about the sudden strange behavior of his employer, who has taken to visiting a ruined crypt at nighttime, and bones are later discovered in his furnace.

programme.title: Framed
programme.desc: A banker's (Barry Sullivan) mistress (Janis Carter) frames a mining engineer (Glenn Ford) to take the fall for an embezzlement.

programme.title: Walk East on Beacon
programme.desc: An FBI agent (George Murphy) works with a refugee scientist (Finlay Currie) and the Coast Guard to crack a Soviet spy ring in Boston.

programme.title: Tall in the Saddle
programme.desc: A cowhand (John Wayne) with no time for women meets one (Ella Raines) who owns a ranch and another one (Audrey Long) whose ranch should be his.

programme.title: Devil's Doorway
programme.desc: A Shoshone Civil War hero (Robert Taylor) returns to Wyoming and fights a crooked lawyer (Louis Calhern) over Indian land.

programme.title: The Fastest Gun Alive
programme.desc: The son of a notorious gunslinger attempts to bury his reputation and avoid his father's legacy in a small frontier town.

programme.title: Blood on the Moon
programme.desc: Down-and-out cowhand Jim Garry (Robert Mitchum) is asked by his old friend Tate Riling (Robert Preston) to help mediate a cattle dispute. When Garry arrives, however, it soon becomes clear that Riling has not been entirely forthright. Garry uncovers Riling's plot to dupe local rancher John Lufton (Tom Tully) out of a fortune. When Lufton's firecracker of a daughter, Amy (Barbara Bel Geddes), gets involved, Garry must choose between his old loyalties and what he knows to be right.

programme.title: Strangers on a Train
programme.desc: In Alfred Hitchcock's adaptation of Patricia Highsmith's thriller, tennis star Guy Haines (Farley Granger) is enraged by his trampy wife's refusal to finalize their divorce so he can wed senator's daughter Anne (Ruth Roman). He strikes up a conversation with a stranger, Bruno Anthony (Robert Walker), and unwittingly sets in motion a deadly chain of events. Psychopathic Bruno kills Guy's wife, then urges Guy to reciprocate by killing Bruno's father. Meanwhile, Guy is murder suspect number one.

programme.title: Bad for Each Other
programme.desc: Dr. Tom Owen (Charlton Heston) is an Army doctor on leave to visit his mother, who still lives in the poor Pennsylvania mining town where he grew up. After falling in love with wealthy socialite Helen Curtis (Lizabeth Scott), Tom turns down a position as the local doctor and takes a lucrative job at an elite Pittsburgh clinic. Though he's happy with his newfound success and his recent engagement to Helen, a cave-in at the town mine forces Tom to decide where his heart really lies.

programme.title: The Wyoming Kid
programme.desc: Slick gambler James Wylie (Dennis Morgan) is apprehended by the law and given the option to forgo a prison sentence if he poses as a bandit. His mission is to uncover the identity of the Poet, a notorious outlaw who has been holding up bank-owned stagecoaches and leaving verses at the crime scenes to taunt the authorities. James finds time to woo the Poet's lovely wife, Ann (Jane Wyman), who initially cold-shoulders him. But, as a romance develops, they partner up to find the robber.

programme.title: Feudin' Rhythm
programme.desc: A snooty sponsor wants the star (Eddy Arnold) of a country-western radio show fired because she wants him kept away from her nephew, who happens to be the singer's son.

programme.title: The Champion
programme.desc: Charlie (Charles Chaplin) wins boxing matches by placing a horseshoe in his glove.

programme.desc: Paid programming.

programme.desc: Pancho and the Kid attempt to prove that they did not kidnap the child they are protecting from a killer.

programme.title: The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The detective tries to clear a man accused of patricide.

programme.title: Bad for Each Other
programme.desc: Dr. Tom Owen (Charlton Heston) is an Army doctor on leave to visit his mother, who still lives in the poor Pennsylvania mining town where he grew up. After falling in love with wealthy socialite Helen Curtis (Lizabeth Scott), Tom turns down a position as the local doctor and takes a lucrative job at an elite Pittsburgh clinic. Though he's happy with his newfound success and his recent engagement to Helen, a cave-in at the town mine forces Tom to decide where his heart really lies.

programme.title: Shine on Harvest Moon
programme.desc: At one time not so long ago, Milt Brower (William Farnum) and Pa Jackson (Stanley Andrews) were peaceable partners in a thriving cattle business. Now divided, the two are engaged in an embittered land dispute that turns ugly when Jackson accuses Brower of the dastardly crime of cattle rustling. Faithful cowboy Roy Rogers (Roy Rogers) steps in to defend his old friend Brower, making him a hero in the eyes of Brower's doting and dainty daughter, Claire (Mary Hart).

programme.title: The Fastest Gun Alive
programme.desc: Former gunslinger George Temple (Glenn Ford) wants to keep his gun-fighting days a secret as he builds a new life. It seems whenever Temple's prowess with a gun is discovered, he and his wife, Dora (Jeanne Crain), have to skip town before someone challenges him to a duel. After eventually settling in a small town as a quiet shopkeeper, a drunken Temple makes the mistake of showing off his skills. When the criminal Vinnie Harold (Broderick Crawford) catches wind of it, a showdown is imminent.

programme.title: Blood on the Moon
programme.desc: Down-and-out cowhand Jim Garry (Robert Mitchum) is asked by his old friend Tate Riling (Robert Preston) to help mediate a cattle dispute. When Garry arrives, however, it soon becomes clear that Riling has not been entirely forthright. Garry uncovers Riling's plot to dupe local rancher John Lufton (Tom Tully) out of a fortune. When Lufton's firecracker of a daughter, Amy (Barbara Bel Geddes), gets involved, Garry must choose between his old loyalties and what he knows to be right.

programme.title: The Wyoming Kid
programme.desc: Slick gambler James Wylie (Dennis Morgan) is apprehended by the law and given the option to forgo a prison sentence if he poses as a bandit. His mission is to uncover the identity of the Poet, a notorious outlaw who has been holding up bank-owned stagecoaches and leaving verses at the crime scenes to taunt the authorities. James finds time to woo the Poet's lovely wife, Ann (Jane Wyman), who initially cold-shoulders him. But, as a romance develops, they partner up to find the robber.

programme.title: A Bullet Is Waiting
programme.desc: Storms trap a Utah sheriff (Stephen McNally) and his prisoner (Rory Calhoun) in a coastal cabin with a professor's daughter (Jean Simmons).

programme.title: The Brothers Rico
programme.desc: Former Mafia bookkeeper Eddie Rico (Richard Conte) has decided to go straight and lives with his wife in Florida, where they plan to adopt a child. However, his brothers, Johnny (James Darren) and Gino (Paul Picerni), still work for his ex-boss, Sid Kubik (Larry Gates) -- and, when Eddie finds out their lives are in danger, he tries to re-establish his connection to the world he thought he had left behind. But when one of his brothers is killed, Eddie realizes that he may be next.

programme.title: The Family Secret
programme.desc: After David Clark (John Derek) kills his drunk, violent friend Art, he explains to his lawyer father, Howard (Lee J. Cobb), that he acted in self-defense. Howard lets David decide whether or not to confess. Disappointed when David refuses to admit to his crime, Howard is further disturbed when district attorney George Redman (Santos Ortega) prepares to prosecute Joe Elsner (Whit Bissell), a bookie Art was in debt to. When his son still refuses to turn himself in, Howard agrees to defend Joe.

programme.title: The Terror
programme.desc: Lt. Duvalier (Jack Nicholson), a French soldier, loses contact with his unit and is forced to wander alone near the Baltic Sea. While in search of his regiment, he spies Helene (Sandra Knight), a mysterious beauty, walking by herself. Mesmerized, Duvalier begins tracking her, but she vanishes. He later catches up with her and follows her into a castle, where he encounters the bizarre Baron Von Leppe (Boris Karloff), finds signs of witchcraft and learns the shocking truth about Helene.

programme.title: The Most Dangerous Game
programme.desc: When legendary hunter Bob Rainsford (Joel McCrea) is shipwrecked on the perilous reefs surrounding a mysterious island, he finds himself the guest of the reclusive and eccentric Count Zaroff (Leslie Banks). While he is very gracious at first, Zaroff eventually forces Rainsford and two other shipwreck survivors, brother and sister Eve (Fay Wray) and Martin Towbridge (Robert Armstrong), to participate in a sadistic game of cat and mouse in which they are the prey and he is the hunter.

programme.title: The Little Shop of Horrors
programme.desc: A clumsy young man nurtures a plant and discovers that it's carnivorous, forcing him to kill to feed it.

programme.title: The Phantom of the Opera
programme.desc: Aspiring young opera singer Christine Daaé discovers that she has a mysterious admirer intent on helping her become a lead performer. This masked presence is Erik, also known as the Phantom, a horribly disfigured recluse who lives underneath the Paris Opera House. When the Phantom takes Christine prisoner and demands her devotion and affection, her suitor, Vicomte Raoul de Chagny, sets out to rescue her.

programme.title: Carnival of Souls
programme.desc: Mary Henry ends up the sole survivor of a fatal car accident through mysterious circumstances. Trying to put the incident behind her, she moves to Utah and takes a job as a church organist. But her fresh start is interrupted by visions of a fiendish man. As the visions begin to occur more frequently, Mary finds herself drawn to the deserted carnival on the outskirts of town. The strangely alluring carnival may hold the secret to her tragic past.

programme.title: 'Neath the Arizona Skies
programme.desc: A cowboy escorts a young half-Native American girl, whose mother has recently died. He must find her white father in order to claim her hefty inheritance.

programme.title: Sundown Saunders
programme.desc: While gambling, Sundown Saunders (Bob Steele) wins the deed to a fertile tract of land and decides to settle down as a rancher. Along the way, he meets Bess Preston (Catherine Cotter), a sheepherder's daughter who, it turns out, was sold rights to the same piece of land. Arriving in town, Sundown tries to get to the bottom of the phony deeds, but crosses Sheriff Baker (Earl Dwire) and winds up a wanted man. He will have to break up the local crime ring if he is to clear his name.

programme.title: Dog Tales

programme.title: Think Big
programme.desc: Children are the future -- and so are their inventions, which is why "Think Big" could be an important show. It features young inventors competing to see who can come up with the most-innovative invention. Each episode features two teams in the Think Tank -- a studio filled with art supplies and construction materials -- who brainstorm and choose materials before sketching, designing and building a prototype to be presented to a judge, who determines a winner. The champions earn bragging rights and the coveted Genius Cup.

programme.title: Love in Wolf Creek
programme.desc: On the eve of a big-city donor's visit, Samantha Groves, director of the wildlife center, teams up with local rancher Austin Spencer and risks the future of her fledging rescue center to find and save a white wolf with life-threatening injuries.

programme.title: County Line: No Fear
programme.desc: When Sheriff Alden Rockwell finally decides to retire, a threat against the father of his friend, Sheriff Jo Porter, may not only ruin his plans for a life of leisure but also bring a dangerous criminal syndicate to both Maksville and York counties.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E14 Ghost of the Cimarron Cheyenne travels with an outlaw gang led by the Ghost of the Cimarron. The gang forces him to aid a wounded gunman. Danger looms for Cheyenne as he is mistaken as a gang member by lawmen and their posse.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E15 Wagon-Tongue North Cheyenne takes on the role of trail boss to help a woman get her herd of cattle to town. He realizes that the man he shot in self-defense is her late husband. More problems arise when he deals with a crew of disobedient trail hands.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E12 Feet of Clay Little Billy Allen's mother has died so he waits for his father at the Cartwrights. Unknown to Billy, his father is a prisoner who has broken out of jail. When the father commits robbery and murder, Hoss is forced to kill him.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E7 Knight Errant Two old friends of Lucas', Don Chumera De Lardo and Colonel Black, come to the McCain Ranch. They are there to finish a deed of honor, even insisting on a jousting match. Lucas learns that the feud started over a chess game.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E8 Honest Abe A neighbor of Lucas' believes he is Abe Lincoln after being mentally injured in the Civil War. Townspeople go along with his impersonation since he is a kind man. However, when a saloon patron makes fun of him, trouble ensues.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E9 The Long Goodbye Stubborn Grandpa Fogerty lives in a rundown house with his grandson, Woody. Lucas tries to get the old man to send the boy to school. The ladies of North Fork want Woody removed from the home and ask Lucas to help them.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E10 The Shattered Idol Famous writer Mark Twain visits North Fork and Mark, who idolizes him, is hurt by his rudeness. Lucas intervenes and discovers the source of Twain's bitterness comes from personal tragedy. Later, both Marks become friends.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S1 E8 An Extra Hand Cody, Bubba, and Booger audition a bunch of local cowboys and non-cowboys to find a ranch hand that can help out when Bubba takes time off to be with his new baby. Bubba and Kaley risk one last trip to Mississippi for a baby shower. Kaley wants to see her family, but they worry that the baby will come early and be born outside of Alabama. After meeting with his banker, Booger is forced to sell off his family's land, but he desperately hopes to find a buyer willing to let him keep a small portion with his grandmother’s house.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S1 E9 New Beginnings Bubba and Kaley welcome their baby girl into the world. When they get home from the hospital, Kaley surprises Bubba with a special gift. Cody lands a big contracting job with a local rancher, but the work needs to be completed in a week. He needs this job to fund the construction of his dream home, so he must get the work done somehow. Booger is beginning to think that Jaclyn might be the one, so he decides to introduce her to his grandma. Finally, the whole gang gets together for a Faith Cattle family barbecue to meet baby Andie.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E31 The Prodigal A bank robber hides at the McCain Ranch and takes Lucas and Mark hostage. Problems arise when the gunman's mother shows up, believing he owns the ranch and Mark is her grandson. The truth comes out when more gunmen arrive.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E32 The Fourflusher Sharecropper Gabe Fenway enters his horse, Sapphire, in a race. His landlord, Jake Preston, bets Fenway that Mark's horse, Blueboy, will win. Preston wants Fenway's farm and bets $1000 against his whole year of crops. He will stop at nothing to win.

programme.title: Love in Wolf Creek
programme.desc: On the eve of a big-city donor's visit, Samantha Groves, director of the wildlife center, teams up with local rancher Austin Spencer and risks the future of her fledging rescue center to find and save a white wolf with life-threatening injuries.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E7 Knight Errant Two old friends of Lucas', Don Chumera De Lardo and Colonel Black, come to the McCain Ranch. They are there to finish a deed of honor, even insisting on a jousting match. Lucas learns that the feud started over a chess game.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E8 Honest Abe A neighbor of Lucas' believes he is Abe Lincoln after being mentally injured in the Civil War. Townspeople go along with his impersonation since he is a kind man. However, when a saloon patron makes fun of him, trouble ensues.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E9 The Long Goodbye Stubborn Grandpa Fogerty lives in a rundown house with his grandson, Woody. Lucas tries to get the old man to send the boy to school. The ladies of North Fork want Woody removed from the home and ask Lucas to help them.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E10 The Shattered Idol Famous writer Mark Twain visits North Fork and Mark, who idolizes him, is hurt by his rudeness. Lucas intervenes and discovers the source of Twain's bitterness comes from personal tragedy. Later, both Marks become friends.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S1 E10 Season Round Up This special edition of The Cowboy Way: Alabama revisits the action from Season One as cowboy trio Bubba, Cody and Booger build their cattle business. Of course the guys have their hands full wrangling cattle and taming unruly horses, but their personal lives are just as action-packed. Newlyweds Bubba and Cody are getting used to being family men, while Booger struggles through a series of dates on a quest to find the love of his life. Chock-full of season highlights as well as hilarious never-before-seen outtakes, it's an entertaining look at the cowboy way of life.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S2 E1 Bubba, Cody and Booger: Back in the Saddle Back for a new season of riding horses and roping cows, cowboy trio Bubba, Cody and Booger undertake a huge cattle drive for Cody's brother in-law in Mississippi. Bubba and Kaley wager a bet on who can better handle the other's workload: Bubba tries his hand at babysitting while Kaley does Bubba's ranch chores. Misty wants to be a stay-at-home mom, but suffers an accident while trying to help Cody on the farm. As Booger and his girlfriend Jaclyn get more serious, Booger considers taking their relationship one step further.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E33 The Jailbird Bessie Steel Weaver welcomes her husband, Farley, home after his release from prison. Lucas hires him as a hand believing he has changed his ways. However, when a murder occurs during a local robbery, suspicions are aroused.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E34 Meeting at Midnight Lucas' old Army buddy, Tom Benton, comes to North Fork raising a ruckus. Micah arrests him and Lucas bails him out. Benton, an undercover federal agent, wants to stay in jail to hopefully infiltrate a gang of bank robbers.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E6 Fool's Gold After discovering a river filled with gold, Jim Bridger and his fellow trappers believe they are near El Dorado, the mythical Spanish city of gold. But their insatiable greed turns friends into enemies and puts Bridger at risk of a gruesome fate.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E5 A Prince on the Prairie While guiding a hunting expedition, Jim Bridger must deal with an arrogant foreign prince who is abusing his servant boy. But the tables soon turn, when it's the prince who needs rescuing, and his only hope is the long-suffering servant boy.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E15 Charles M. Russell: The Cowboy Artist Charlie Russell is an aimless cowhand who loves the freedom of the cowboy way of life, and he is a self-taught artist who enjoys capturing the scenes of his rugged work on the range. Too embarrassed to ask people to pay for his paintings, he gives most of them away to friends or trades them for drinks at the saloon. But that changes quickly after he falls in love. Charlie's new bride Nancy gives him the encouragement he needs to stop cowboying in order to focus on his artwork. Under her watchful eye, he sobers up, stops cowboying, and improves his mastery of painting. Nancy is so proud of Charlie's talent that she doesn't hesitate to ask top dollar for his paintings. Years later, when legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson tries to do a piece on Charlie, he quickly realizes that he must first deal with the woman behind the famous cowboy artist Charles M. Russell.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E4 The Legend of Nat Love When Black cowboy Nat Love overnights in Deadwood during a cattle drive, he decides to enter a Fourth of July cowboy competition. Confident in his roping, riding, and shooting skills, he is eager to test his mettle against the best cowboys around.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S3 E6 Christopher Gist: Unsung Hero of the First Frontier After mapping the rugged Ohio Country, frontiersman and surveyor Christopher Gist accepts a new mission: lead a young George Washington to a remote French fort in the Ohio wilderness on a diplomatic journey which may change the course of history.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E20 Then There Was One Teaspoon travels to Texas with an old comrade to warn three aging veterans that someone has been murdering the last men who genuinely remember the Alamo. Jimmy and Buck follow from behind as Teaspoon tracks down the killer.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E16 The Long Search Cheyenne joins in the search for a missing 10-year-old boy along with the help of a Sioux boy named Char. While the boy finds himself trapped by a cave-in, the locals find his horse nearby and suspect the Sioux took him.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E17 Standoff Cheyenne finds a wounded man in Mexico and takes him to a doctor in a local village. Once he arrives, he learns that a dangerous bandit is there to avenge two of his men's deaths by destroying the village.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E13 Death at Dawn When a member of a powerful gang of outlaws murders a local shopkeeper, the killer is sentenced to be hanged. The leader of the gang kidnaps Ben and holds him hostage in an attempt to gain the killer's freedom.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E11 Long Gun from Tucson A killer, John Holliver, and his followers come to North Fork looking for revenge. All of the residents are terrified since they ran him out of town five years earlier. Lucas, now acting marshal, realizes that he must face Holliver and his men alone.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E12 The High Country Two mountain men, Ambrose and Gorwin, come to the McCain Ranch. Ambrose is captivated by Lucas' rifle but Lucas won't trade it. After Gorwin is killed trying to steal it, the family holds Lucas accountable.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E13 A Friend in Need A man named Carl Avery kidnaps Mark and demands a $5,000 ransom for his safe return. Lucas mortgages his ranch to a longtime friend for the money. When Lucas delivers the ransom, he discovers his friend is part of the disturbing kidnapping plot.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E14 Skull Lucas and Mark are separated on a hunting trip. During his search, Lucas enters Skull Ranch, a headquarters for outlaws. The gang forces him to help break out two members from jail. Lucas has no choice after he learns they've captured Mark as well.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E15 Charles M. Russell: The Cowboy Artist Charlie Russell is an aimless cowhand who loves the freedom of the cowboy way of life, and he is a self-taught artist who enjoys capturing the scenes of his rugged work on the range. Too embarrassed to ask people to pay for his paintings, he gives most of them away to friends or trades them for drinks at the saloon. But that changes quickly after he falls in love. Charlie's new bride Nancy gives him the encouragement he needs to stop cowboying in order to focus on his artwork. Under her watchful eye, he sobers up, stops cowboying, and improves his mastery of painting. Nancy is so proud of Charlie's talent that she doesn't hesitate to ask top dollar for his paintings. Years later, when legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson tries to do a piece on Charlie, he quickly realizes that he must first deal with the woman behind the famous cowboy artist Charles M. Russell.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E4 The Legend of Nat Love When Black cowboy Nat Love overnights in Deadwood during a cattle drive, he decides to enter a Fourth of July cowboy competition. Confident in his roping, riding, and shooting skills, he is eager to test his mettle against the best cowboys around.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S3 E6 Christopher Gist: Unsung Hero of the First Frontier After mapping the rugged Ohio Country, frontiersman and surveyor Christopher Gist accepts a new mission: lead a young George Washington to a remote French fort in the Ohio wilderness on a diplomatic journey which may change the course of history.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E20 Then There Was One Teaspoon travels to Texas with an old comrade to warn three aging veterans that someone has been murdering the last men who genuinely remember the Alamo. Jimmy and Buck follow from behind as Teaspoon tracks down the killer.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E16 The Long Search Cheyenne joins in the search for a missing 10-year-old boy along with the help of a Sioux boy named Char. While the boy finds himself trapped by a cave-in, the locals find his horse nearby and suspect the Sioux took him.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E17 Standoff Cheyenne finds a wounded man in Mexico and takes him to a doctor in a local village. Once he arrives, he learns that a dangerous bandit is there to avenge two of his men's deaths by destroying the village.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E13 Death at Dawn When a member of a powerful gang of outlaws murders a local shopkeeper, the killer is sentenced to be hanged. The leader of the gang kidnaps Ben and holds him hostage in an attempt to gain the killer's freedom.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E11 Long Gun from Tucson A killer, John Holliver, and his followers come to North Fork looking for revenge. All of the residents are terrified since they ran him out of town five years earlier. Lucas, now acting marshal, realizes that he must face Holliver and his men alone.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E12 The High Country Two mountain men, Ambrose and Gorwin, come to the McCain Ranch. Ambrose is captivated by Lucas' rifle but Lucas won't trade it. After Gorwin is killed trying to steal it, the family holds Lucas accountable.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E13 A Friend in Need A man named Carl Avery kidnaps Mark and demands a $5,000 ransom for his safe return. Lucas mortgages his ranch to a longtime friend for the money. When Lucas delivers the ransom, he discovers his friend is part of the disturbing kidnapping plot.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E14 Skull Lucas and Mark are separated on a hunting trip. During his search, Lucas enters Skull Ranch, a headquarters for outlaws. The gang forces him to help break out two members from jail. Lucas has no choice after he learns they've captured Mark as well.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S2 E2 Put a Ring on It When an infection threatens the herd, Bubba, Cody and Booger have to act fast. They enlist the help of young veterinary student Dakota to doctor the cows and keep the virus from spreading. Cody helps Misty take the first step towards starting her cattle business. The cowboys decide to build an office for the company, but Bubba throws a wrench into the plan when he's called to Mississippi to visit Kaley's parents. Bubba's in-laws pressure him to take a hard look at his future while Booger works up the nerve to pop the question and start a future with Jaclyn.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S2 E3 Tradition vs. Technology A routine job turns tough when the cowboys struggle to wrangle the herd across a highway, sparking Cody's idea to use GPS devices so they can easily find cattle in the pasture. Bubba hides a cow in the woods and Booger challenges Cody to prove GPS technology beats traditional methods. Misty and Kaley help Jaclyn find the perfect wedding dress while Bubba fails to fit into his tuxedo pants, prompting Booger and Cody to put him on a weight-loss regimen. Cody writes a song in honor of Booger's wedding and surprises Misty with a trailer for her new cattle business.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E35 Nora An old flame of Lucas' comes to North Fork. After Lucas learns she is sick and her deceased husband spent all her money, he goes to help. However, all is not as it seems as she didn't come alone, and Lucas' good deed involves him in a murder.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S2 E36 The Hangman Lucas arrives at Eban Muchen's ranch to deliver supplies. He finds Muchen's body and hired hand, Voleny Adams, right next to him. Adams denies he killed Muchen, but no one in town believes the ex-convict and want him to hang.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E7 Molly's Choice A young Jim Bridger helps a Shoshone woman escape the clutches of her abusive husband. As Bridger squares off against the frontier ruffian and his henchmen, he soon realizes that the woman he is helping is none other than the legendary Sacajawea.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E8 The Snakeroot Cure When a young girl is bitten by a rattlesnake, mountain man Jim Bridger finds himself in a race against time to save her arm and keep her alive as he desperately searches the wilderness for a medicinal plant that once saved the life of his friend.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E5 The Masterson Brothers Part 1 After Marshal Ed Masterson is shot while breaking up a barroom brawl, he hastily bans all firearms in Dodge City. Ed's swift proclamation is met with disdain by most townsfolk, including his own brothers, and places an even larger target on his back.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E6 The Masterson Brothers Part 2 After Marshal Ed Masterson is gunned down in Dodge City, his youngest brother, James, decides to follow in his footsteps and become a lawman. But when James' life is threatened, middle brother Bat Masterson races back from Arizona to protect his kin.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S3 E1 Anne Bailey: Horseback Heroine After Anne Bailey's husband is killed by Native Americans, she defies the social norms of the frontier and becomes a horseback courier, risking her life to race through hostile territory delivering vital supplies to isolated forts and settlements.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E2 Ghosts Rachel is troubled by a tragic incident from the past. The riders help clear her name after she was wrongfully charged with murder. Teaspoon finally finds out Lou's secret, but still allows her to continue as a rider.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E18 Dead to Rights Cheyenne goes on the hunt for his partner when he doesn't return from a private business trip. He leaves to hunt for him and learns that he is wounded and in jail. Later, Cheyenne deals with an estate and lawyer.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E19 Noose at Noon With his friend, Jim O'Neil's hanging scheduled for the next day, Cheyenne visits him in Texas. Jim refuses to tell Cheyenne any details, but Cheyenne uncovers the missing clue that prevents his innocent friend's hanging.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S2 E1 Showdown A young bank robber decides to get a job at the Ponderosa with the Cartwrights in an attempt to prevent the local sheriff from learning the whereabouts of his accomplices, known as the feared Pardo gang.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E15 The Princess Lucas and Mark find a young woman named Jennifer and her ill brother, Charles, hiding in their barn. Doc Burrage treats the boy for measles and they take refuge at the McCain Ranch, but soon Lucas learns that she may be a runaway princess from Europe.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E16 Gunfire Infamous outlaw Charlie Gordo is in the North Fork Jail waiting for the U.S. Marshal to take him to Yuma for hanging. Micah learns that the lawman is dead, and Gordo's gang is arriving soon. Micah, Lucas, and others defend the jail from the gang.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E17 The Quiet Fear Jake Striker buys Brice Hornsby's farm after moving to North Fork. Townspeople befriend Jake's pretty daughter, Abbey, who is deaf and cannot speak. Problems arise when a trail bum attacks her and blames the hired hand. Lucas must find the truth.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E18 Sporting Chance Englishman Jeremy Pennebroke arrives in North Fork and announces he has come to kill Lucas McCain with his custom-made rifle. He believes if he guns Lucas down, he will earn respect and a reputation. Ironically, Lucas later defends Pennebroke.

programme.desc: S2 E2 Put a Ring on It When an infection threatens the herd, Bubba, Cody and Booger have to act fast. programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E16 Gunfire Infamous outlaw Charlie Gordo is in the North Fork Jail waiting for the U.S. Marshal to take him to Yuma for hanging. Micah learns that the lawman is dead, and Gordo's gang is arriving soon. Micah, Lucas, and others defend the jail from the gang.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E17 The Quiet Fear Jake Striker buys Brice Hornsby's farm after moving to North Fork. Townspeople befriend Jake's pretty daughter, Abbey, who is deaf and cannot speak. Problems arise when a trail bum attacks her and blames the hired hand. Lucas must find the truth.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E18 Sporting Chance Englishman Jeremy Pennebroke arrives in North Fork and announces he has come to kill Lucas McCain with his custom-made rifle. He believes if he guns Lucas down, he will earn respect and a reputation. Ironically, Lucas later defends Pennebroke.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S2 E4 Bulls on the Beach While the cowboys are sorting the herd, Cody suffers a close call on the job that sets off a string of bad luck as he plans his annual rodeo, Bulls on the Beach. He struggles to impress a potential sponsor and the entire event is put in jeopardy when the bulls don't arrive as scheduled. Bubba heads to Mississippi to work for his father-in-law and try his hand at office life. Booger and Jaclyn enjoy learning the first dance for their wedding, but Booger finds himself awkwardly out of place as the only man at their bridal shower!

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S2 E5 Saddle Up or Settle Down? Bubba, Cody, and Booger have their work cut out for them removing a dangerous cow from a local rancher's herd. Bubba continues to shadow his father-in-law, making his first business pitch to a potential client. He begins to realize a life in Mississippi could prove to be very lucrative, but he isn't ready to hang up his spurs just yet. Misty convinces Cody to let her have his ranch horse for her new cattle business, requiring Cody and Booger to train a replacement colt for Cody. Booger and Jaclyn find wedding planning to be more troublesome than they anticipated.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E1 Trail of Hate Three bank robbers come to the McCain Ranch and force Lucas into helping them rob the North Fork Bank. One robber stays behind to guard Mark while the other two take Lucas to town. They threaten to kill Mark, unless Lucas cooperates with the gunmen.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E2 Woman from Hog Ridge When Lucas and Mark catch two young men stealing a horse, Lucas is forced into a shootout. He captures one of the men, but Ma Boyle's son is killed in the gunfight. Soon after the killing, the Boyle clan comes to hang the person responsible.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E9 The Prizefighter When Jim Bridger's second-in-command begins enforcing camp discipline with brutal violence, one trapper pushes back, and a showdown seems inevitable. Can Bridger intervene before the situation turns from mutual hostility into cold-blooded murder?

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E10 A Shard of Glass Haunted by the memory of leaving a man to die, mountain man Jim Bridger is determined not to repeat the mistake. When his trapping party runs out of water while crossing a barren desert, Bridger struggles desperately to keep his companions alive.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E2 The Texas Fence-Cutting War When homesteaders keep cutting down her fences to access grazing land and water, a widowed landowner teams up with famed Texas Ranger Ira Aten to protect her property. Aten hopes his explosive plan of action will force the cutters to compromise.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E11 Battle Beneath the Mountain For months, a thin wall of rock is all that keeps the peace between two rival silver mining companies 300 feet below the Idaho desert. When the barrier is finally breached, pickaxes give way to pistols and rifles, and the miners battle for five days.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S3 E7 George Croghan: Frontier Peacemaker When Chief Pontiac organizes a coalition of Native American tribes to attack British forts, frontier trader George Croghan risks his life on a perilous journey into the wilderness to find Pontiac, negotiate a peace agreement, and prevent all-out war.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E3 Dead Ringer A gunman impersonating Jimmy as Wild Bill Hickok, robs banks in the territory. Jimmy goes undercover to find out who is framing him. To catch the gunman in the act, the riders position themselves at the next bank that he plans to rob.

programme.title: Blind Spot
programme.desc: Cheyenne rides into a small cotton town to pick up a friend's son to try to reunite a family bitterly divided by the Civil War. He soon battles hatred and greed by a vigilante gang that is holding the town captive.

programme.title: Reprieve
programme.desc: Sheriff Pinkerton deputizes Cheyenne, and he transports crook Wes McQueen to a hidden fortune. When someone shoots and kills McQueen, Cheyenne impersonates him in order to find the bounty.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S2 E2 The Mission Captain Pender is looking for a scout and Hoss suggests former scout Charlie Trent. Charlie is less than dependable because he feels responsible for a massacre in the past. Now, he spends most of his time with a bottle.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E19 A Young Man's Fancy A pretty young girl named Sally Walker arrives on stagecoach in North Fork to visit her aunt Milly. When Mark sees her beauty, he falls in love with Sally instantly. However, she has her eyes on a boy from her past, Bruce Henry, who owns a ranch.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E20 The Man from Salinas Lucas is acting deputy while Marshal Micah Torrance is away on business. When the North Fork Bank is robbed, Lucas shoots and critically wounds Rudy Gray. Problems arise when a man posing as Gray's brother arrives in town.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E21 Two Ounces of Tin A gunman named Tip Corey, whose father was allegedly murdered in North Fork, rides into town and threatens to kill Marshal Micah Torrance. Corey gives Micah an ultimatum: take his badge off or he will end his life.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E22 Deadly Image A local rancher, who claims to be an eyewitness, accuses Lucas of murder. Townspeople are shocked until Earl Bantry, who looks like Lucas' twin, arrives in North Fork. Bantry, a ruthless criminal, threatens Mark and goes on a rampage against Lucas.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E21 Two Ounces of Tin A gunman named Tip Corey, whose father was allegedly murdered in North Fork, rides into town and threatens to kill Marshal Micah Torrance. Corey gives Micah an ultimatum: take his badge off or he will end his life.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E22 Deadly Image A local rancher, who claims to be an eyewitness, accuses Lucas of murder. Townspeople are shocked until Earl Bantry, who looks like Lucas' twin, arrives in North Fork. Bantry, a ruthless criminal, threatens Mark and goes on a rampage against Lucas.

programme.title: Blue Ridge
programme.desc: Ex-Green Beret, Justin Wise, trades in his life of danger for a sheriff badge in a sleepy town at the heart of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Now closer to his ex-wife and daughter, he's ready to settle down and embrace a life without chaos. But trouble has a way of following him. Just when he starts getting adjusted to the simple life, a murder in the community puts the residents on edge and refuels a longtime feud between two of the most powerful families. As Justin and his deputies work the case, he realizes there is more to his new home than meets the eye. Secrets unfold, and motives emerge, leading Justin on a race against time to solve the case before the townspeople take the law into their own hands.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E3 Seven A prison wagon carrying seven criminals stops in North Fork for supplies. The men escape, barricade themselves in the North Fork Saloon, and take saloon owner, Frank Sweeney, hostage. Lucas must act quickly to save Sweeney and the town from harm.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E4 The Pitchman A fast-talking con man and his teenage son stop at Lucas McCain's Ranch and try to talk their way into securing the mineral rights. However, the plan backfires when they discover the gold they thought was on the property is actually fool's gold.

programme.title: Buffalo Keepers
programme.desc: S1 E1 Today, the buffalo is the quintessential symbol of strength, freedom, and the unspoiled American West. But in the late 1800s, the nation's buffalo were nearly wiped out by ruthless hide hunters. Those majestic herds, which once numbered in the tens of millions, were down to less than 500 animals. This is the story of the handful of determined men and women who mobilized to save the ones that were left in a last-ditch effort to stave off extinction. Ranchers like Charles and Mary Ann Goodnight rescued orphaned buffalo calves and built small herds. Former buffalo hunters like Buffalo Bill helped build public sympathy. And politicians like Theodore Roosevelt helped pass laws to protect the remaining animals. The effort would be a generational one, with buffalo herds carefully tended, bred, and passed down to new stewards when their old protectors passed away. Thanks to their efforts, there are an estimated 500,000 buffalo thundering across America's grasslands once again.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E7 Doc Susie Goes Underground After the suspicious death of a tunnel worker, and unconvincing answers from the project's lead engineer, Doc Susie goes on a covert mission to find out what happened. Deep underground, she finds her own life in peril when she's trapped by a cave-in.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E10 Jim Roberts Cleans Up Jerome In his first week on the job as the new constable of Jerome, Arizona, Jim Roberts gets to work arresting the town's troublemakers and teaching his timid deputy how to be a courageous lawman as they track down a stone-cold killer and his gang.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S3 E5 James Harrod: Kentucky's Founding Father When frontiersman James Harrod founds Harrod's Town on Native American hunting grounds in Kentucky, he soon finds his new settlement under attack. His leadership is tested as he defends the first European settlement west of the Appalachian Mountains.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E4 Blood Moon A cholera outbreak spreads fear among the townspeople of Sweetwater. They blame a defenseless, mentally disabled boy named Danny, who traveled to town with a medicine show. Now, the riders must protect him from an angry mob of citizens.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Gunmen While in Texas, Joe and Hoss are mistaken for the Slade brothers who are involved in a feud between two families. In order to stop the fighting, they decide to turn to the women of the families for help.

programme.title: The Sundowners
programme.desc: When a dispute over grazing rights to a fertile canyon leads to cattle rustling, the rustling ignites a range war, turning two brothers against one another. Will both brothers survive the deadly conflict between them?

programme.title: Abilene Town
programme.desc: It's the late 1800s and a marshal must stop a volatile and growing conflict between homesteaders and cattle drivers in his small town on the Kansas frontier.

programme.title: Blue Ridge
programme.desc: Ex-Green Beret, Justin Wise, trades in his life of danger for a sheriff badge in a sleepy town at the heart of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Now closer to his ex-wife and daughter, he's ready to settle down and embrace a life without chaos. But trouble has a way of following him. Just when he starts getting adjusted to the simple life, a murder in the community puts the residents on edge and refuels a longtime feud between two of the most powerful families. As Justin and his deputies work the case, he realizes there is more to his new home than meets the eye. Secrets unfold, and motives emerge, leading Justin on a race against time to solve the case before the townspeople take the law into their own hands.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E3 Seven A prison wagon carrying seven criminals stops in North Fork for supplies. The men escape, barricade themselves in the North Fork Saloon, and take saloon owner, Frank Sweeney, hostage. Lucas must act quickly to save Sweeney and the town from harm.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E4 The Pitchman A fast-talking con man and his teenage son stop at Lucas McCain's Ranch and try to talk their way into securing the mineral rights. However, the plan backfires when they discover the gold they thought was on the property is actually fool's gold.

programme.title: Buffalo Keepers
programme.desc: S1 E1 Today, the buffalo is the quintessential symbol of strength, freedom, and the unspoiled American West. But in the late 1800s, the nation's buffalo were nearly wiped out by ruthless hide hunters. Those majestic herds, which once numbered in the tens of millions, were down to less than 500 animals. This is the story of the handful of determined men and women who mobilized to save the ones that were left in a last-ditch effort to stave off extinction. Ranchers like Charles and Mary Ann Goodnight rescued orphaned buffalo calves and built small herds. Former buffalo hunters like Buffalo Bill helped build public sympathy. And politicians like Theodore Roosevelt helped pass laws to protect the remaining animals. The effort would be a generational one, with buffalo herds carefully tended, bred, and passed down to new stewards when their old protectors passed away. Thanks to their efforts, there are an estimated 500,000 buffalo thundering across America's grasslands once again.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E7 Doc Susie Goes Underground After the suspicious death of a tunnel worker, and unconvincing answers from the project's lead engineer, Doc Susie goes on a covert mission to find out what happened. Deep underground, she finds her own life in peril when she's trapped by a cave-in.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E10 Jim Roberts Cleans Up Jerome In his first week on the job as the new constable of Jerome, Arizona, Jim Roberts gets to work arresting the town's troublemakers and teaching his timid deputy how to be a courageous lawman as they track down a stone-cold killer and his gang.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S3 E5 James Harrod: Kentucky's Founding Father When frontiersman James Harrod founds Harrod's Town on Native American hunting grounds in Kentucky, he soon finds his new settlement under attack. His leadership is tested as he defends the first European settlement west of the Appalachian Mountains.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E4 Blood Moon A cholera outbreak spreads fear among the townspeople of Sweetwater. They blame a defenseless, mentally disabled boy named Danny, who traveled to town with a medicine show. Now, the riders must protect him from an angry mob of citizens.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Gunmen While in Texas, Joe and Hoss are mistaken for the Slade brothers who are involved in a feud between two families. In order to stop the fighting, they decide to turn to the women of the families for help.

It is hosted by Whitney Fitzsimmons. The program provides daily rundowns of Australian, Australasian, and International economies, as well as commentaries on financial and political outcomes.

programme.title: A Week in France
programme.desc: Follow coverage of events in Paris and across France Corsica and the French overseas territories. An insider look at French politics and culture.

programme.title: G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra
programme.desc: (2009) Action adventure with Channing Tatum, Sienna Miller and Christopher Eccleston. Terrorists steal a devastating weapon and only the USA's finest - the GI Joes - can stop them.

programme.title: M3GAN
programme.desc: (2022) Creepy-doll horror with Allison Williams. A robotics engineer simultaneously invents an AI dolly and takes on the care of her orphaned niece. But can a cyborg really raise a kid?

programme.title: Bullet Train
programme.desc: (2022) Leaving from Platform 4 - a high octane, Shinkansen-set comedy thriller with Brad Pitt, Joey King and Michael Shannon. A jaded assassin does one last job on a villain-packed train.

programme.title: Barbarian
programme.desc: (2022) Don't-go-down-in-the-cellar horror with Georgina Campbell. A double-booked Airbnb leads a woman into some very dark places beneath the house she's staying in. With Bill Skarsgård.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Robin and Marian
programme.desc: (1976) Touching romance starring Sean Connery and Audrey Hepburn. The ageing legend Robin Hood returns to Sherwood Forest and discovers that, while he was away, Marian has become an Abbess.

programme.title: The Sound Barrier
programme.desc: (1952) Drama starring Ralph Richardson as a pioneering aviator determined to break the sound barrier, even if it means risking the lives of those closest to him. Directed by David Lean.

programme.title: Carrington, VC
programme.desc: (1954) Anthony Asquith's vivid and subtle courtroom drama casts David Niven as the eponymous officer accused of stealing army money and going absent without leave.

programme.title: Last Night in Soho Interview...
programme.desc: ...Special: Director Edgar Wright and co-writer Krysty Wilson-Cairns discuss travelling through time and recreating the past to make the ingenious and atmospheric psychological thriller.

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the...
programme.desc: ...Fallen: (2009) Raucous sci-fi action sequel with Shia LaBeouf and Megan Fox. Can Sam and Mikaela prevent the scourge of the Decepticon robots from destroying the Earth?

programme.title: Last Night in Soho Interview...
programme.desc: ...Special: Director Edgar Wright and co-writer Krysty Wilson-Cairns discuss travelling through time and recreating the past to make the ingenious and atmospheric psychological thriller.

programme.title: Where the Crawdads Sing
programme.desc: (2022) Daisy Edgar-Jones stars in director Olivia Newman's adaptation of Delia Owens' best-selling novel about a feral child who's accused of murder in America's Deep South. Did she do it?

programme.title: The Night House
programme.desc: (2020) Supernatural horror with Rebecca Hall. A woman starts to think her dead husband is haunting her as she wrestles with her grief in the isolated lakeside house he built for them.

programme.title: Pig
programme.desc: (2021) Thriller. Nicolas Cage delivers a subtle turn in Michael Sarnoski's debut, an intriguing tale of an off-the-grid truffle hunter who returns to the city to rescue his kidnapped pig.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: (1954) Crime-comedy starring Alec Guinness. A priest is tasked with accompanying a priceless religious artifact from London to Rome. But the prolific thief Flambeau is hot on his trail...

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: (1954) Western starring Dana Andrews. A man falsely accused of murder gets a last-minute reprieve from the lynch mob so he can track down the real culprit.

programme.title: Mandy
programme.desc: (1952) Poignant Ealing drama starring seven-year-old Mandy Miller as a deaf girl whose parents - played by Phyllis Calvert and Terence Morgan - fight over her treatment.

programme.title: Nicholas Nickleby
programme.desc: (1947) Drama with Derek Bond, based on Charles Dickens' novel. After his father dies, Nicholas seeks the help of his cold, avaricious, scheming uncle. Predictably, it doesn't go well.

programme.title: First Knight
programme.desc: (1995) Romantic drama based on Arthurian legend, starring Richard Gere, Sean Connery and Julia Ormond. Can nomadic swordsman Lancelot contain his love for King Arthur's fiancée?

programme.title: Late Night with the Devil
programme.desc: (2023) Unsettling found-footage horror with David Dastmalchian. A has-been host tries to save his 70s talk show using a demonically possessed 13-year-old girl. Really, what could go wrong?

programme.title: Angel Has Fallen
programme.desc: (2019) Action-thriller sequel. Secret agent Mike Banning (Gerard Butler) goes on the run when he's framed for an attack on the President. Can he clear his name?

programme.title: Isolation
programme.desc: (2005) Gory horror with John Lynch, Essie Davis and Sean Harris. Biotech experiments bring bloody mayhem to a struggling Irish dairy farm.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Siege at Red River
programme.desc: (1954) Western. Van Johnson stars as a Confederate agent who steals a Gatling gun prototype from the Yankees and attempts to smuggle it south through enemy lines to his own side.

programme.title: The Enemy Below
programme.desc: (1957) Second World War thriller. Robert Mitchum stars as the captain of a US destroyer in the North Atlantic hunting down a German U-boat and its world-weary captain, Curt Jurgens.

programme.title: The Colditz Story
programme.desc: (1954) Classic Second World War drama. John Mills, Lionel Jeffries and Bryan Forbes star as just some of the POWs determined to break out of the infamous German 'escape-proof' prison.

programme.title: Jubal
programme.desc: (1956) Western with Glenn Ford, Ernest Borgnine, Rod Steiger and Valerie French. A cowboy is given a job by a rancher, sparking lethal jealousy in a colleague and desire in the boss's wife.

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
programme.desc: (1993) Comedy sequel starring Whoopi Goldberg and Lauryn Hill. Deloris - who's now made it big in Vegas - goes back undercover as a teacher to help a struggling school choir find its voice.

programme.title: Copshop
programme.desc: (2021) Action thriller with Gerard Butler. A hitman gets himself arrested so that he can get to a bad guy, who also got himself arrested, so that he could hide from the hitman.

programme.title: Alita: Battle Angel
programme.desc: (2019) Partially animated action film based on a popular manga comic. Alita, a deadly cyborg brought back to life by a mourning scientist, sets out to discover her true identity.

programme.title: Corpus Christi
programme.desc: (2019) Crime drama. A young ex-con wants to be a priest so much that he pretends to be one. But trouble soon finds him. In Polish/subs. Strong language/violence/sex/drugs.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Man Between
programme.desc: (1953) Atmospheric thriller set in post-war Berlin, where Ivo Kern (James Mason) and Susanne Mallison (Claire Bloom) get caught up in a maelstrom of bigamy, blackmail and bullets.

programme.title: Gideon of Scotland Yard
programme.desc: (1958) Drama. Jack Hawkins stars as Police Inspector Gideon, who faces outrage and danger in his quest to bring London's criminals to justice. With Anna Massey, John Loder and Cyril Cusack.

programme.title: Footsteps in the Fog

programme.title: The Masque of the Red Death

programme.title: Cast iron cowboy

programme.title: Buck Commander
programme.desc: A group of former and current professional baseball players, along with a pair of country music stars, team up with outdoorsman, hunter and author Willie Robertson. Best known for his appearances on A&E's "Duck Dynasty," Robertson aids his co-owners of the Buck Commander Co. in the woods for deer season. Forming a bond and sharing a few laughs, Adam LaRoche, Ryan Langerhans, Tombo Martin, Luke Bryan and Jason Aldean use their signature tools to score big. Following the success of their company, the guys give viewers an inside look at the tools and knowledge of being a successful hunter.

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons
programme.desc: A murderer tries to kill his final victim as the car they occupy slowly sinks to the bottom of a lake; the only way to save the victim is to rescue her as the car continues to sink; test firing multiple handguns underwater.

programme.title: Buck Commander
programme.desc: A group of former and current professional baseball players, along with a pair of country music stars, team up with outdoorsman, hunter and author Willie Robertson. Best known for his appearances on A&E's "Duck Dynasty," Robertson aids his co-owners of the Buck Commander Co. in the woods for deer season. Forming a bond and sharing a few laughs, Adam LaRoche, Ryan Langerhans, Tombo Martin, Luke Bryan and Jason Aldean use their signature tools to score big. Following the success of their company, the guys give viewers an inside look at the tools and knowledge of being a successful hunter.

programme.title: SpeedFreaks
programme.desc: Go in-depth with the big names in racing, showcasing a side of these athletes rarely seen with a unique interview style and flair combining elements of commentary, entertainment and lifestyle.

programme.title: 2025 STARS National Series
programme.desc: The bravest ASA STARS National Tour wheelmen in the world take on Winchester Speedway for the Winchester 400.

programme.title: 2025 GT World Challenge America Highlights
programme.desc: Racing across America's best circuits, this division represents the highest echelon of GT racing in the country by exclusively using GT3 class cars competing in 90-minute races.

programme.title: The Charge: Mustangs at Le Mans
programme.desc: For the first time ever, the Mustang Challenge held an international round at the famed Circuit de la Sarthe, as nearly 40 Mustangs took to the iconic track and competed in the race of a lifetime. We meet the drivers, including Tanner Faust and Frankie Muniz, and chronicle all the on track action… in The Charge: Mustangs at Le Mans.

programme.title: Road to Glory
programme.desc: We go behind the scenes and get to know the drivers behind the helmet; from seasoned veterans to young upstarts, each racer has a different path but one goal -- to win the title.

programme.title: 2025 British GT Championship
programme.desc: The British GT Championship is one of the longest-running GT programs in the world. It has two divisions - GT3 and GT4 and is one of 5 GT Championships around the world (Europe, America, Asia and Australia being the others ) operated by the SRO Organization.

programme.title: Racers Unchained
programme.desc: From motocross domination with seven AMA national championships, to leading in the Indy 500 and jumping into Stadium Super Trucks and off road racing, Jeff Ward has done it all; he sits down with Paul Tracy for a conversation.

programme.title: LOKAR Car Show
programme.desc: The return of the iconic NOPI Show features their first regional car show and drift event at Lanier Raceway.

programme.title: Dealer Life
programme.desc: Get to know Dan and the crew through a day in the life at a Harley-Davidson dealership; the crew rides over to Lucky's Saloon for Bike Night, sharing a glimpse of the rich culture behind the Harley-Davidson brand.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey demonstrates how to change a four-headlight classic Chevy truck into a two-headlight classic Chevy truck, just by changing some sheet metal. Is it as easy as it looks, or are there some hidden challenges waiting to bite you?

programme.title: Sam's Garage
programme.desc: Sam continues on with our '98 GMC Holley OBS project by completing the installation of the powertrain.

programme.title: Prodigy Racing League
programme.desc: Drafted by Williams, G2, Guild, BS+, SuckerPunch, and Thibaut Courtois, 30 of the world's best gamers, from 100K+ who entered season 1, battle in the Prodigy Racing League. Only 20 advance to the next PRL series. This is the future of motorsports.
